text: We were lucky to stay here for the last three nights of our Bali vacation and stayed in the villa with infinity pool. Total privacy, food served in our own villa as well as beautiful surroundings (the owners have included art in their interior design) make this an absolute stand out! We were very relaxed and also enjoyed the general area as you have many possibilities to explore the night market of Amlapura or the water temples. Next time we definitely want to check out the white beach! The food served was absolutely delicious. The only thing I would have wished for is that I could have been able to opt for a starch/meat free meal option after my detox but I get that at this size (four villas) you would rather go for excellent (healthy and balanced) meals instead of putting an extra emphasis on health/ weight loss, so no complaint here. We will be back for sure!
title: Dreamy Location for Couples

owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words! We are very pleased that you enjoyed staying with us so much!!! :-)

We appreciate your effort to write this review, as we are constantly trying to improve the service for our guests even more. Actually, we can always adapt our daily food choices according the diet wishes/needs of our guests. It seems that our staff didn´t point this possibility out to you clearly enough, I apologize for that! We also offer vegetarian and/or vegan options and are happy to offer starch free/gluten free food, too. We also have a special "Detox Package" which caters exactly your requirements, so next time you come just say that you want "Detox"-food and we will be happy to prepare it for you. :-)

Thanks again for staying with us, we are already looking forward to welcome you again here at Shunyata Villas Bali!

Best wishes and all the very best to you!
Your Shunyata Villas Bali Team

They have amazing villas that nobody can disturbed you you have the privacy to do whatever you want in the villa.  Food that was really done with pride...
title: A Hidden Paradise

text:
My husband and I stayed in Shunyata Villas for 2 nights in August. We had booked the Sky Villa and had the most amazing time over there. The place is unbelievably gorgeous with amazing views over the ocean and a very luxurious villa. 

The rooms are equipped with everything you could possibly need for a comfortable vacation. The outdoor bathroom is lovely as is the private pool and bathtub. The bed is extremely comfortable as are the deck chairs on the outdoor deck. The staff were extremely friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we need. 

They have a huge variety of food available for breakfast - every evening their lovely staff would come with a menu and ask us to select what we want for breakfast the next day. Although we both are vegetarians, there were plenty of options available such as fresh fruits, juice, trail mix, oatmeal, pancakes, tea, coffee, etc. All the food is organic and freshly prepared. We didn't get a chance to try their lunch and dinner menu because we had brought our own ready-to-eat food from home (being Indian vegetarians, we generally do not get too many options outside) which the staff was kind enough to help us cook. We did try some side dishes from their menu and those were delicious as well.

The main pool is wonderful too, specially if you want to get a good workout swimming laps. The staff helped us to hire a scooter and we drove down to Amed for one day, but came back early because we wanted to spend maximum amount of time in our lovely villa! 

There was nothing more peaceful then lying on the deck chairs and reading a book while listening to the waves crashing on the rocks below the resort. When we returned, we felt like we had a truly relaxing and healing experience. We would love to visit again given the chance.

A huge thank you to the team at Shunyata Villas for making our vacation memorable!
title: Best part of Bali vacation

text: Amazing experience. Very quiet, you will hear nothing else than birds and waves crashing on the shore. Our villa was a jewel, very comfortable, full of light and air. Frangipani flower smell all around. You cannot be disapointed if you come here. Everything was just perfect. The restaurant, contrary to what you can expect in such isolated place serves extraordinary good food at reasonable prices. In brief: just come.
title: Unique.

text:
I can not say enough about my stay at Shunyata Villas - from the grounds, to the food, to the staff, to my villa, everyting was beyond expectation.

Seraya is a little known village in Bali, almost untouched by tourism, and the perfect place to unwind, and I couldn't imagine a better place to do it than Shunyata.  

My villa was spotless (and kept that way by a seemingly invisible cleaning staff), incredibly private, and exceedingly comfortable - lounge furniture on the terrace, in the bedroom, and a hammock in the bathroom, as well as sun  loungers by the pool. and the view can not be beat.

The staff exceeded every expectation - friendly without being overbearing, considerate, and anticipated my every need. On-site management was excellent as well, checking in regularly to insure that my stay was going well.

The spa services were great, and the food on offer was spectacular - varied, healthy, and delicious.

The caveat is that this is not a hotel for those looking for any kind of hustle and bustle or heavy site-seeing.  There are day trips that can be organised, but Seraya is a small, truly Balinese village, so there is nothing geared to tourists within walking distance  But if this is what you want (which I did) then Shunyata is the perfect plae to unplug, unwind, and treat yourself.

I will be back as soon as possible.  Thank you for a wonderful stay!
title: Perfect - Did not want to leave

Greetings from Bali

Roland

text:
From the moment we walked through the doors to our villa, I was in disbelief that a place so beautiful existed and that we would be calling this place home for the next 3 days.  I am not sure I can express in words how beautiful this experience was but I will do my best.

We stayed in an ocean view villa and were so pleased with our villa!  The decor was light, bright, and airy.  It was was very clean.  There was a beautiful outdoor shower and separate giant tub with optional rainfall shower head, in addition to a detachable shower head.  Due to jet lag, I was often up in the wee hours of the morning and I would go sit out in the tub and read or just enjoy the sounds of nature waking up in the morning.

There was plenty of closet space in our villa, including shelving and space to hang your garments.  The villa included a small kitchenette with filtered water, coffee and tea.  Bug spray was also available in the room.

The view of the ocean from our terrace was stunning.  The private pool was perfectly open to the beautiful ocean view, but still private from other guests at the resort.  We would not have changed a thing about our villa!

The food was this unbelievable combination of health and deliciousness that you don't often come across but they nailed it.  I eat a mostly plant based diet and they were able to accommodate this with no problem, having a few options at each meal.  I wish we would have taken a cooking class or two because I often found myself trying to figure out how they made each of their creations.  My favourite breakfast item on their menu was their ayurvedic green soup!

We ate all our meals at the resort.  Some of our meals we ate in our room and others in the restaurant.  There was always a wonderful variety of menu items that rotated through their lunch and dinner menu.

The location of the resort is a little remote, but we loved this!  When we went for a walk, we found farm animals, a little area with a swing by the ocean, and a nearby learning centre.  No tourists in sight :)

We enjoyed an outdoor massage during our stay and there happened to be a downpour of rain at the time of our massage.  This just made the experience more magical!  The sounds of the ocean combined with the heavy rainfall... it was perfect and the ladies did a wonderful job!

The service was over and above any expectations we could have had.  Everyone we met was kind, gracious, respectful, and extremely helpful.  To say they went above and beyond would be an understatement.  I've never felt so cared for in a resort before.

The entire experience felt like a dream and we have every desire and intention to return back to this paradise dream when we are able.  

Our only complaint is this... We booked two resorts for our stay in Bali and the second resort didn't stand a chance in comparing to the Shunyata.  We were kicking ourselves for ever leaving the Shunyata to stay elsewhere.  

I cannot speak highly enough of this resort.  I feel so blessed and thankful to have had the opportunity to stay in this ocean paradise.
title: Like a dream.

photos.caption: Outdoor bathroom tub  - Ocean View Villa
View from private pool - Ocean View Villa
Our beautiful room - Ocean View Villa
Private terrace dining area - Ocean View Villa

text:
From the moment you get of the plane in (Bali Denpasar airport) you are overwhelmed by people and the smell of jasmin in the air, a short process to pass emigration and customs you walk out of the airport with the impression that you could easily get lost, hundreds of cab driver wants your business and they are very forthcoming. 
Fortunately, we booked the shuttle from the villa, and the people at the villa where kind enough to send a picture of the driver and a his shuttle, well worth the price in consideration that this was our first time in Bali and I feel you could get scam easily here, the driver was holding a sight with the villas name when we walk out of the arrival.  
  The ride will take 2.5 hrs, the driver said and he was right,  first they drive left side of the streets, and they have no speed limits, scooters are the main form of transportation du to the high cost of owning a car, and they do a good job of passing you left and right mingling with the traffic at over 50klm hrs, 
Arriving at the villas we were greeted by the manager that received us with a local flower neckless that was freshly pick for our arrival with a few hot towels 
Getting in our room was exceptionally pleasant as we saw our main entrance door from the lobby
Entering the ocean view 1 room was a very exceptional with the view that was presented to us by the layout of the room we were immediately drawn by the view of the sea overt the infinity pool
The room was clean as new and well supplied with the minibar towels and bath products
All organic by the way
First night was revealing to us, first the star night and the breeze from the sea, the sound of the waves pounding on the cliff bellow
This is one way for me to describe the effect the place had on us…
We were fortunate enough to have the breath of god on us and hear the beat of his heart through the pounding of each wave followed by the sound of clapping spirits at the retreat of each waves……all this with the animal symphony of his kingdoms and the discovery of the gecco’s song……
If you want to fell close to god and find yourself submerged by sent of wellbeing while being accompanied by people that serves you like a king…. this is where you need to be.
You will eat very well everything fresh and organic served with attention to detail and with a touch of passion for your wellbeing…..
This place is not for the people that needs to remain busy, this is to relax and enjoy the moment given to you by these great people that design this site with the attention to give you as much privacy as you need…enough to feel comfortable to swim and walk around nude if you want.
title: Haven's heartbeat.......A place to find yourself

text:
My partner and I were lucky enough to spend two nights in the Sea Villa at Shunyata.

Amazing location overlooking the ocean, huge infinity pools and plenty of space that makes you feel like there is no one else around.

The room was fantastic and we loved lounging on the daybed, reading books and catching the sunset.

The food was delicious and fresh. We had full board, vegan menu. The best tasting vegan food we ate in Bali. The chefs really know plant based food.

We also loved the focus here on sustainability and preserving nature.

We recommend to anyone searching for a peaceful retreat with a dash of luxury.

text: We can only agree with the many positive reviews: the Shunyata Villas are beautifully situated with fantastic views of the sea. The whole complex is extremely high quality and luxurious. text:
For our birthdays the best friend and I stayed for the 7-day wellness and tour package.  It was amazing!  Our room, Ocean View,  was beautiful, well maintained, and very clean.  Daily housekeeping was always on time and turn down service was much appreciated every evening.  The private pool was maintained daily and any and every request was met quickly and with kindness and patience.  Most of our visit we felt like we were the only guests at the resort,  although I'm sure there were other guest on site.  

Maria the owner provided us with amazing and insightful crystal healing table sessions.  Don't sneer at them, she is knowledgeable, kind, and effective.  Hey energy speaks to how much she really cares about your growth through the experience and she sends you away with personalized letters as a reminder of your time spent and all that is possible for your  purpose in this world.  She is a truly beautiful soul.

For our tours our driver, Kartika, was more than a driver, he was a tour guide, a dinner guest, a cultural ambassador, a personal photographer, an inspiration, and truly truly an embodiment of the joy of the country.  His English was excellent too, but even if it hadn't been I would have enjoyed him all the same.  His #1 priority was giving us the experience of a lifetime and he went above and beyond to do so.   He engaged in every activity with us with as much zeal and joy as if it were his first time.  We were so happy to have him along, and his skills as a cell phone photographer were unmatched!  No need for selfies.

The resort staff including Manuel were amazing and truly bought into our experience.  Nothing was hurried, we were on vacation, and from time to time we had to be reminded of that.  The beauty of the resort, the soothing smells, sounds of the ocean, calmness and purity of a place truly designed to bring you to peace.  Amazing.  Thank you to Shunyata for a trip of a life time.
title: A healing and spiritual experience.

text:
It's very small just 3 villas, + a couple more upcoming, and it's absolute heaven, right above the mighty ocean... The owners are both German - so everything is perfekt (!): well thought-out/eco-friendly/community responsible - and they are experts in Tai Chi and Qi Gong (yoga also available - I have not tested) . I have tested the Kundalini massage which is incredible! The food is healthy ( a bit oily maybe sometimes...) and they happily cater to vegan, gluten free...etc. The lack of choice for dinner is a bit annoying first, but that's one thing less to think about and I ate less this way, which is great! :-)
... It is luxury, so not cheap to Bali standards, but you get plenty for you money, very big villas, private pool + 36m (!) infinity pool... They also are generous with their time and energies :-) 
Sadly one cannot swim just below the hotel, but the free transfer to Virgin Beach is easy and the beach there absolutely gorgeous :-)
We did not want to leave and hope to come back soon! :-)
title: fabulous place to unwind/reconnect with yourself and/or your loved one

text: Shunyata was our first stop in Bali as part of our honeymoon in which we stayed 3 nights. After a 25 hour journey and 2 hour drive from the airport, it was still worth it. We got to the villa close to midnight so couldn't realise the pure beauty until the next morning. And was it worth it, that view! We stayed an the sky villa and had an amazing private pool, you'd probably struggle to find a private pool so big anywhere else. The villa was huge, bedroom, wardrobe area, the bathroom was incredible, amazing tub, these was a separate day lounging area with dining area and a kitchenette, as well as another outdoor bathroom. We wanted somewhere we could relax for a few days after a long flight and hectic wedding, and this is the place to go. The staff were lovely, extremely polite and the food was nice and very organic. We had most of our meals in our separate dining area in the villa but also went to the restaurant, the views from both were to die for. You could just stare into the sea for ages after breakfast. Could not fault anything, would recommend to anyone wanting to relax and getaway to peace and quiet and not wanting to be disturbed. Bliss.
title: Pure Bliss

text:
To get to Shunyata you follow a small side  road that is currently been remade so I would use a local taxi service that knows the area. 
On arrival we were warmly greeted and shown to our villa. This was to us the only disappointment to our stay. When we book a villa especially as there are only 3 here (with another being built) expect it to be a stand alone villa however ours, The Delight Villa,  would prove to have another above it. Had we known this we wouldn't have booked it as I  dont consider this a villa.

Everything else about our stay however was excellent and soon turned our disappointment into a 5 star review.
Having said that the room was very well decorated and the fittings were modern classy and tasteful.

The place is very remote which we knew so expect to eat at the onsite restaurant. I must say that this is exceptionally good. Although there is only 1 dish on the menu each day when it was something we didnt like other options were soon offered. The service and food really was 1st class. We had Red Snapper which tasted fantastic and was cooked to perfection.

The owners of Shunyata are very friendly and welcoming and this is the approach they have instilled in the staff. 

The owners approach sits perfectly with the ambience of the place and we couldnt have asked for more while staying here.

I would recomend Shunyata without any hessitation we loved the food the people and the premises.
title: Great remote location

text:
We visited Shunyata in March - picking the place after a considering quite a few options. We were looking for a break and did not want a tourist heavy location.

And Shunyata did not disappoint! We had planned to see a few places around the area but dropped the plan after seeing Shunyata. The locations is gorgeous, the resort layout is great, the rooms are tastefully furnished and privacy is ensured due to its size and seclusion. The infinity pool overlooking the cliff and the sea was a treat.

The food was great - a touch tailored to the western palate, well presented with local flavours. While your choices are a bit limited on options for meals due to its location, we had no reason to complain. You can ask for the meals to be served in your rooms (on the deck) - which was great for us as we were travelling with our seven month old baby. 

The staff was extremely warm towards our baby and made us feel at home.

Take your pick - spend sometime at the bottom of the cliff watching the sea crash into the rocks, do some yoga, swim in the infinity pool, get a massage at the spa, watch the gorgeous sunsets and sunrises, gaze out at the fishing boats - if you want to just BE - Shunyata is the place for you
title: Luxury and secluded escape

text:
I had only three days in Bali after an important meeting in Jakarta, so I did some prior research on TA and elsewhere to seek out the best spot to relax and enjoy, without being as rich as the King of Saudi Arabia, who visited the island at the same time.
My choice fell on Shunyata Villas, and that was one of the best decisions I have made in my entire travel life.
The place is totally wonderful, especially the pristine location on unspoiled coastline so beautiful it makes you want to cry for gratitude, the superior elegance and comfort of the villas, and the dedication of staff to fulfill all your needs , serve you wonderful food, and otherwise avoid disturbing your privacy. I also found Shunyata to be very reasonably priced considering the splendor and pure joy of being in such a great place.
I could write pages on how much I enjoyed myself, let me just offer a few descriptions and recommendations.

First, OK, I was very lucky: The rainy season had ended early, just a week before, so weather was mostly sunny and starry.  Also I had the whole place nearly to myself. There are three villas; another family was in one of the others the first day, but then left. However, there is plenty of space available, I think even with a three villas occupied, you would only meet at the very large and spectacular pool and the restaurant, if you choose to. 

I reserved the SEA villa, which is a bit more expensive than the other two, but utterly perfect in terms of views, comfort, design, bathing and sleeping facilities, yes everything, so much worth it. Unnecessarily large for just one person of course, but it does not feel 'too big', just like a super privilege. Ideal also for two. There are no TVs, which I see as a blessing, you can check news etc. (or just forget about it as I did) via the wifi which I found to work OK most of the time for sending email and checking travel info.

A total gem: At SEA villa you have your own private 10-12 meter infinity pool, so secluded you can swim naked if you wish, and still with a view of the sea and coast so great that you literary do not want to leave the water. The other villas have own pools too, but I could not observe them from anywhere, the privacy is total. 
I found that all of the facilities in my Villa were well conceived and designed, in perfect working order, and clean. I loved the choice of materials, furniture, and decorations; elegant, tasteful, yet practical and convenient. The bathroom is built to impress but also serves all your needs perfectly.

I had my two dinners and one lunch at the restaurant, with what must be one of 
the best views on Bali.  You sit on an elevated terrace under a traditional style roof and look out over the ocean to the horizon with Nusa Panida and Lombok in the distance, the rocky coastline with few small fishing boats and the rolling waves hitting the shore (that sound…), then further on to the lovely rural Balinese countryside with lush green tropical vegetation, a few farm houses, and in the far background the looming volcano. No technical or touristic developments in sight anywhere; a feast to the eyes, morning and sunset.
The food was very good and sufficient too. It is labeled as ‘gourmet’, which I think is deserved, with nice three course dinners, although do not expect ‘michelin star’ levels of creativity. It is based on mostly organic products, local fish, etc., and nicely presented with flowers etc. by charming local staff. 
I prefer wine with my dinner on vacations and surely wine is available and at a surprisingly reasonable price. Not a big selection or extreme quality, but just what I needed at least; decent, chilled white or red with dew on the glass in the tropical sunset, for less than I would pay at restaurant back home, wow! Even the Bintang’s in your villa fridge are like two Euro’s, where I was expecting at least twice that amount. 
Two mornings I had my breakfast served in the villa as this is your own choice when you order in the evening. There are several items to select among and I found it good and filling but after several days I suppose you could feel a need for more variety; Tip: the ‘Balinese pancakes’ are most delightful when you add yoghurt and local jam to them, otherwise a bit chewy…  
No broad white sand beach (I guess here would be big hotels then), this is not why you choose this place, but to my surprise actually a small quite picturesque volcanic black sands beach just below the Villas, invisible and secluded, and perhaps not safe for swimming but amazing for a short walk or longer hang out, all by yourself with the ocean. 

I made the choice to do two excursions, which in a way is crazy when you are already in paradise for a few days. Also the local road there is so awful that excursions are bumpy and unpleasant the first/last 10 minutes. But also silly to leave the rest of Bali totally unexplored, right? So, one full day excursion with driver/guide to Ubud and rice terrace areas in the interior of the island, and a half day trip with driver/guide to Amed in the north for snorkeling. Both trips were interesting and worthwhile, but Ubud and terraces trip is  better done from elsewhere on Bali if you have a chance. I spent more than 5 hours in the car that day which is way too much, even if both car and driver are nice. Fair to say the Shunyata staff did inform me. It was purely my own choice, and I still had a lovely experience for relatively low cost, and an even more wonderful return to the pool and drinks…  The Amed trip on the other hand is so worth doing from Shunyata, as much for the totally beautiful road up there and back as for the snorkeling itself. The latter is fine (lots of pretty, funny fish, OK equipment for hire, easily accessible), but I suspect more amazing snorkeling waters with more intact corals can be found elsewhere in Indonesia, if that is your focus.

As an indication of my appreciation of the Villas, I took as least as many pictures of the property and its surroundings as on both of my two excursions combined!

Thank you so much to hosts Jürgen and Maria Neurohr for creating this fantastic place and making it accessible (although not too easy, which is good!) to people like me. Vacation and hospitality at its very best!
title: My strongest recommendations

owner_response.text:
Dear guest,

Thank you very much for presenting such a detailed description of your stay in our little paradise. It is a great help to other travelers to make a stay at Shunyata more tangible. We are delighted that you had a wonderful time and enjoyed the beauty, peace and warm hospitality at this place. 
We are glad you also could explore our surroundings and Balinese culture by doing daytrips to Amed and Ubud. 
We deeply hope you can keep your memories upright by looking at your pictures.

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We have traveled a lot around the world and stayed in many luxury resorts and boutique hotels, but Shunyata Villas tops them all.  The location is remote but well worth it!  It is really hard to describe the beauty and quiet energy of this location and the elegance of the villas and resort.  This is a very special place where both the sunrises and sunsets are spectacular!  We stayed 5 nights in the Sea Villa, which is beautifully designed and decorated with custom furnishings and artwork and so comfortable.  It was such a luxury to wake up and swim in our own 14 meter pool every morning, or sometimes we walked the steps down to the beach to watch the sunrise and then swam in the 36 meter pool at the centre of the boutique resort.   The staff are naturally warm and friendly and the service is top notch.  The cook at the restaurant prepares healthy, flavourful and beautifully presented organic gourmet dishes.  Vegetarians and vegans are also very well catered for.  I am vegetarian and loved all the creative dishes and delicious sauces which the cook prepared for me. The views from the restaurant are breathtaking, overlooking the sea, resort pool, garden and the frangipani trees on the neighbouring meadow with goats and cows.The owners have thought through so many details for the comfort of the guests. There is a place for everything so you feel right at home. They also provide a natural body spray to keep mosquitos away and we didn't have any bites during our stay and saw very few mosquitos overall, although it was the rainy season.  Mosquitos usually find me and eat me up!  I could go on and on because we absolutely loved every detail!  There were occasional shy geckos peeking out from a wall or ceiling and butterflies flying through the open lounge.  It was luxury in the midst of nature.  We could have easily stayed for weeks there and hope to do so next time. There is so much to explore in the area and we visited the water palace in Ujung after we checked out, but there is another water palace in the area, as well as beautiful beaches, a harbour for ferries to neighbouring islands and a panoramic seaside road along the cliffs. However as we were only there 5 nights we just wanted to enjoy the beautiful resort and our peaceful villa. The final stretch of road to reach the resort is quite bumpy, but the government plans to fix that road sometime this year, as they have recently completed another one in the area. We look forward to our next visit to this tranquil oasis!
title: The Most Beautiful Oasis!

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest, thank you very much for your feedback and your visit to the Shunyata Villas Bali. We also enjoyed having you here, and are very pleased that you could relax at our resort and enjoy our pool, facilities as well as the fantastic views.
Looking forward to welcoming you again. With best regards from Bali, the Shunyata team

text:
We treated ourselves to a couple of days of luxury at the end of our holiday in Bali and Shunyata surpassed itself. 

The location and views have to be some of the best in the world.  From the terrace (and pools), you can look out onto the ocean and coastline without seeing any other development. It's incredibly peaceful..... you sit there listening to the waves on the beach and watching the locals out on their traditional fishing boats and any stress just evaporates.

The rooms are beautiful and a lot of care has been taken over their decoration. They're all private so you have the choice of keeping yourself to yourself or spending time down in the frankly stunning main pool. 

The dinning is very good, well presented and healthy too. My wife also booked in for a massage and came back very happy.

I would thoroughly recommend staying at Shunyata as an idilic get-away.

owner_response.text:
Dear Bruno,
Thank you very much for visiting Shunyata Villas Bali. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our spacious villa suites with own pool and our eco-infinity pool of 36 meters. owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We arrived at 4 am in the morning. It was pouring with rain and the roads were starting to flood in places. Our first impression was where had we come to. The last few kilometres of road were full of holes and bumps and seemed to take forever. We were greeted by a Balinese member of staff who gave us a cold drink and cold towel and took our breakfast order. We couldn't make out much as it was very dark but we could hear the waves crashing and a rumble of thunder. The next day I woke early opened the curtains and wow what a view. We stayed in the Sea Villa which had an amazing infinity pool overlooking the ocean. Our room was lovely the bathroom was beautiful with a large outdoor shower. We had a separate living/dining room with a small kitchen where there was a fridge stocked with drinks (chargeable) and a large container of water. 
We ate our breakfast in our room and it was fantastic. It was lovely being able to eat in your room and the food was very tasty. We had paid in advance for our food and had full board on the first day. We didn't like the choice we were offered for our lunch but when we mentioned it to the manager she arranged for an alternative which was a delicious prawn salad. We spent our first day lazing by the enormous pool which we had to ourselves as we were the only people staying. We walked up the track to the temple then explored the little village which was delightful. The local villagers were very friendly and the children practised their english with us. Most of the houses had animals and we saw lots of calves, kids and tiny black piglets. This was how Bali must of been before it became commercialised and it was an amazing experience to stay in such a remote location.
We ate in the restaurant both nights we stayed and thought it was some of the best food we had eaten on our trip and we are very demanding diners! We even saw the vegetables being picked in the garden for dinner. If you stay ask for the Rendang it was the best we have ever had.
The service was fantastic, the property was very clean and all the staff were very friendly. We found the management to be very helpful and there was no trying to make us buy their holistic/ spa activities. 
We had a driver for half a day who took us to a couple of local temples and then to Amed. The drive had some amazing views of paddy fields and the coastal road back to Seraya was stunning. 
This is a place to relax and escape from the hustle and bustle of every day life. We loved it and hope to return.
title: Blissful retreat from the world. Wow!

owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for your review and we love to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. The bumpy road you mentioned in your review has been promised to be fixed this year. Our local drivers are well-experienced and know how to get you to our resort in a comfort way. 
And thank you very much for highlighting the dishes, our friendly staff and the services we offer on-site. We would love to greeting you again at Shunyata Villas Bali. Peace within
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We spent 2 nights here on a round-trip in Bali and chose this resort based on the Tripadvisor reviews. Coming from Pemuteran we had quite a challenge finding this: the tel number on the website was not working,the signage on the bumpy coastal road was irregular and barely visible. The (hairpin and windy) road even goes from bad to worse and ends up literally in a dirt track/road to get to the hotel!  Be prepared that 10 km will take you an hour. It has stunning views but do not be in a rush. 
Once arrived, the hotel staff explained that they were aware of it but it was not in their hands. Despite many requests, getting the road fixed was a long term goal and it was 'in process'. Fine, but then at least put a note on the hotel website and get clear and complete signage along the way. Even a location/access map.
The whole resort comprises of only 3 villas and comes across as peaceful and serene. The concept of the hotel is focused around natural health & meditation concept. Upon arrival were welcomed with a lovely frangipani flower necklace.
The staff was friendly and we received a lot - too much after a stressful 5 hour drive - of information on the hotel's concept. When coming from such a drive, with all due respect, the only thing guests want is to get to the room and the most important information so to de-stress on the terrace. 
The villas do have a stunning view, are clean and the decoration is stylish, with proper A/C, a lot of attention to detail, all the interior being in white. They are lacking real warmth/Balinese spirit and almost feel sterile. 
To our surprise there was no TV nor sound-system. 
There was a kitchen/minibar with a good supply of (arjurvedic) drinking water. But the trash bin (organic) had not been emptied) and the shower gel bottle was empty.
Even though we were asked before our trip of our dietary requirements (nice touch),  the meal hours were tight and there was not much flexibility: we needed to make a decision on the meal we wanted far in advance (1/2 day) and dinner hours were over 1,5 hour span. You miss that, you miss dinner. There was no surcharge for in-room dining but the food was entirely overpriced (all prices were in EUR and at European level: 56EUR for a 2 pax simple 3-course dinner, with out tax) - Bali is not expensive, all of the other hotels we stayed at had Balinese prices and we got the same quality of food so we did not appreciate prices being in EUR. A lack of integration into the local culture according to us.
When we asked for a staff member to come to our room and elaborate a little on the various spa treatments we got invited (asked to be there at a specific time) by the (German) resort owners to the restaurant. Once arrived, we were asked if we wanted something to drink... we thought it was a nice gesture... till it turned out we got fully charged for that drink ! The owners came across as distant and patronizing.. and their English was pretty broken. 
The food was well presented, the meals were OK but definitely not the best we tasted in Bali and 'organic' felt again overpriced - for Bali that is. Breakfast was yummy: lots of choice/ healthy organic / homemade chocolate spread and juices etc
We had a treatment which was done by Balinese - in an outdoor pavilion with the sound of the sea in the background - very nice. But no treatments after 5pm, which is usually the time we have treatments (after a day at the pool). Bummer.
The lap/infinity pool (36 meter) had stunning views, and the water does not contain any chemicals, thanks to a special self cleaning system where you do feel the difference on your skin.
The pool towels were unfortunately stained and worn out, same with the lounge cushions. The pool shower was non-existent. Not acceptable for a resort with European prices. 
In the room we had an outdoor small pool nicely done, with flowers and a lava stone bath tub and the water was clean.
The bathroom was outdoor (just covered) with one indoor (covered) shower and one outdoor (uncovered). 
In terms of activities, there is no sand beach, it is black pebbles that can be accessed via stairs - at low tide as the sea is pretty rough. So don't expect beach activities - the first sand beach is 1 hour away.
The day of our check-out we had to vacate the room at 11am -too early in our opinion - but we could spend the time at the pool while waiting for the driver
The (German) owners were very knowledgeable with regards to their health concept but did not have a client-friendly nor service-oriented mindset. Their spoken English was very rough and they did not have the warm Balinese hospitality (not once we were asked how our stay was). Marlene, the day manager was friendly, helpful and responsive, we expected a bit more of personalized approach though (drop by during the day or give a call) given the resort only has 3 villas.
All in all, I have only given the resort 3 stars - the location is fabulous, the views amazing, the style is very serene but it is way overpriced and does not have the Balinese service/ customer oriented friendliness we had at other (less pricier) locations. Property maintenance could be improved. At one point one (non Balinese) staff member even mentioned that "they (the Balinese) should adapt to us and we should not adapt to them" (!!). We enjoyed our stay but it was definitely not the best of the lot, for the price paid.
title: Peaceful .. at the end of the world

owner_response.text:
Dear Stephanie,

thanks a lot for choosing our eco-luxury boutique Resort as your accommodation in Bali. The team of Shunyata was very happy to welcome you in our resort.

We would like to answer to your comment, clear up misunderstandings and make sure that the quality standards in our Shunyata Resort remain as high as possible. 
As our resort is very secluded, we can offer the luxury of silence and exclusiveness. Another consequence is that our phone connection is sometimes not working so well, even if it is good most of the time. We are currently working on this issue and are sure that it will get better soon. We would like to apologize for any inconvenience. 

The last 1,8 kilometers of the road to our resort are more challenging to drive but experienced drivers can manage that easily. Therefore, we recommend Shunyata’s drivers or drivers who know this area well. Of course this part of the road is not as you would imagine one in Europe, but we think this is a part of the adventure which makes your holiday at Shunyata Villas Bali unique and authentic. Moreover, we inform our guests about the duration of the transfer (2,5 h) via E-Mail and it is also mentioned on our website, so that our guests are aware of it.

As our vision is a place within peace, silence and without too many distractions, we want to go without TV or soundsystem. If you like to have any entertainment systems, you can - of course - feel free to bring your own devices and also use them in connection with our wifi.

The management of our resort consists of highly qualified members with excellent English-knowledge. We always care about your satisfaction and want to get feedback to enhance your stay in our resort.

The team of Shunyata Villas Bali consists of 15 Balinese employees who are mostly from Seraya, the village in which Shunyata Villas Bali is situated. Therefore, we often have Balinese rituals and ceremonies with our team and the integration is a natural part of our co-working. Also the German owners of our resort are aware of the importance of the Balinese culture and also support our employees in many aspects of their lives, such as a fair salary, health insurance and a pension scheme.

The equipment of our resort gets renewed and refurbished all the time. Furthermore, our towels and our furnishing fabrics get cleaned very often and also renewed from time to time. All in all, we are always taking care that our equipment is in best condition.

In our pool area there is a shower inside a cabin and also outside beneath the pool. Furthermore, we can also offer massages outside duty hours, after prior information about your wishes. Our resort has access to a volcanic beach. If you prefer a sand beach, you can easily visit the White Sandy Beach within 40 minutes.
We are very pleased about your feedback and we are very sorry for any inconvenience during your stay. Furthermore, we hope that we can meet your customer' needs at our Eco-Luxury Resort during your next stay with us. 

Kind greetings from Shunyata Villas Bali
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We had the unforgettable experience of staying in the Delight Villa for 7 nights. This place far exceeded our expectations and the whole holiday was truly magical. The staff and management are wonderful and couldn't have been more welcoming. 
The villa and grounds were amazing - total luxury - with every detail you could ask for covered. The shared pool and it's view are spectacular and we spent a great deal of time just taking it all in while relaxing on the edge of the pool or the sunlounges - for the most part we had this pool to ourselves. If you get sick of that there is always your private pool at the villa. The location is remote - which suited us perfectly as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and leaving the kids behind! - but the advantage of this is that you get to see a side of Bali that you simply don't get at the busier more touristy areas. The travel from the airport is comfortable and easy and as soon as you leave Denpasar you get to see some beautiful scenery along the way. This does mean that eating anywhere other than Shunyata is difficult however with food as amazing, diverse and healthy as they offer this is no problem - we chose full board after arriving which was perfect and meant the biggest decision we had to make each day was whether to eat our meals in the villa or at the restaurant (we did a mixture of both) During our stay we took advantage of many of the activities that Shunyata has to offer including a sunrise meditation with Asim, crystal therapy and daily massages which were all wonderful and truly added to our stay. Our favourite activity however, was the Balinese cooking course - this involved a trip to the markets early in the morning with the chef which was so much fun (a true taste of the real Bali as you shop with the local villagers) as well as a morning cooking up a storm in the kitchen (complete with our own personal recipe book to take home) which we then got to eat for lunch - can't recommend this highly enough.
If you are looking for total relaxation, wellness and luxury away from the crowds - then Shunyata is the place for you!
title: Amazing, peaceful, realxing - exceeds expectations

owner_response.text:
Dear Bree, 
Thank you very much for your great review. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Shunyata Villas Bali so much. We loved to have you as our guests and we are looking forward to welcoming you at our Eco-Luxury Boutique Resort soon. All the best, Asim
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Everything was amazing - very warm welcome from the staff that was extremely helpful, the villas are beautiful, the pools are, albeit hot for those exposed to the sun, very nice to lounge in and the food was incredible! We were aiming for a relaxing trip, far from the touristic spots of Bali and got it 100%! 
The masseuses were great and very flexible with times, we got to plan our days exactly how we wanted thanks to a very helpful staff..
The location is very remote - do not expect to be dining elsewhere than the hotel, honestly but we rented out a scooter for next to nothing and drove around during the day finding beaytiful places to go visit! If i go to Bali again, i would definately come here!! 
We found beautiful rice fields that Ubud can envy without all the touristic flow that goes with it.
The owners have created a similar hotel in Sri Lanka - we are definately thinking of going soon!!
This place will not disappoint..i truly recommend it!
title: Stunning, peaceful and so relaxing!

text: We stayed in the Sky Villa, one of only three villas at the property. They are all close together, but you rarely hear noise from the others (other than people plopping into their private pools). The room was everything you'd expect from a high-end place; very comfortable bed, lots of space, tastefully decorated, a wonderful view out across the ocean to Lombok, and a private plunge pool out the back in the bathroom area. You will generally want to eat at the hotel; the nearest restaurants are probably 40 mins away by car (this place is in the middle of nowhere, which was the attraction for us). The food, though, is wonderfully healthy and tasty. Don't expect chicken parmigana or chips; lots of healthy fruit, veggies, and locally caught fish. Just don't bring the kids... there will be nothing for them to do. There is a local pebbly beach at the bottom of the property, but you wouldn't spend much time there.
title: Beautiful, relaxing, wonderful healthy food, great service

text: Simply put, this place is paradise and far exceeded my expectations on every level. From the second we arrived, we were given an extremely warm and personal welcome that would extend to the amazing service we received throughout the entirety of our stay. The staff went through great pains to be attentive to our needs while also respecting our privacy, and the owners checked in on us now and then to make sure we were happy, and even treated us to drinks on our first night. The room was incredible, as were both the private and shared pools. I was at first reluctant to commit to full board but am so glad I did, because each meal featured some of the best food I've ever had. Another unexpected bonus of the secluded location was that we found the local villagers to be incredibly friendly, and we never had to deal with anyone trying to milk money out of us like in the more touristy areas. We desperately want to stay here again and have already started saving money to do so. If you're planning a honeymoon like we were or just want to get away from it all, I honestly can't think of a better option. Book a stay and don't look back! You won't regret it!
title: Never stayed anywhere better!

text:
After more than 12 times in Bali, there is still hidden gems to visit... 
Amazing place!
All is quite, no motorbike noise, only sea waves, wind and birds.
Sea villa with a huge private pool giving you a magic landscape view from sun rising till sunset.
And if the private 15m pool is not enough, there is a 36m long waiting for you to be shared with 4 other guests... incredible.
Service offered is on top level.
Don't hesitate to take the full board package as the restaurant is just excellent, higher than indonesian standards but with a typical indonesian flavour.
title: A GEM! Peace and relaxation

photos.caption: Sea villa view from private pool

text:
If you would like to escape from busy city lifestyle and wouldn't mind it took 2:30-3:00 hours drive from the airport. 
Then this is the place for you. 
Their view, their villa , their food and their services is exquisite. 

Woke up with the wave of the ocean and having your own private pool and relaxing.. It was like a heaven on earth for us. 
Words just couldn't describe how wonderful this place is.. You need to experience with yourself.
title: this place is a gem

text: This place is an absolute haven.  The rooms and private pools are exquisite and enormous.  The infinity pool is the best I have ever seen; looking out over a cliff top view into azure ocean.  The food is healing and delicious (the best homemade bread ever) and the hosts warm and unobtrusive. The village adjacent to the resort is rustic and isolated, meaning you can walk around and experience the real Bali.  It is honestly the best place I have ever stayed. We will be back.  On top of all of that, it affordable! Ruth
title: The most relaxing place on earth

text: Me and my husband stayed in shunyata for few days , words and photos cant express how charming it is , i dont think there is such great sea view in any other villa in bali . the villa design really nice and modern , the staff were so friendly and helpful , food is excellent , place is clean , calm just for ultimate relax ,  the pool  is very clean and you cant smell clor ,  if you are visiting bali you MUST visit.
title: Amazing , you must visit

text: We spent 3 nights at Shunyata. It is about 2.5 hours from the airport but is worth the drive. This location is perfect if you want a couple days to slow down on your trip. And as you have read in other reviews, truly the photos do not do this place justice. Our villa (Retreat) was absolutely magical. We felt like rock stars and did not want to leave. The hotel got back to us within 24 hours of requesting arrangements for a driver from our hotel in Ubud to Shunyata. And on our drive, they called the driver to ask if we wanted lunch prepared on our arrival. With only 3 villas, you really feel like you got away. And I think we only saw one couple one time during our stay. We had fun marking the boxes for our breakfast selections. No limit! We had breakfast once in our villa and the other two mornings at the hotel (we loved the scenery change and the view from the restaurant). The food at dinner was amazing. Very fresh and great flavor. While staying we arranged drivers both days. Once day we went to the White Sands Beach (very nice beach-but smaller than expected). And also went to the water palace Tirta Gangga. That was fun to see. We also had a massage and the setting and massage were worth the money spent. And the main hotel pool was most amazing and we were the only ones that used it (since the retreat villas pool does not get sun). It was like we had two pools to ourselves. And don't even get me started on how wonderful the bathroom is in the Retreat Villa. Two showers and an amazing tub in a beautiful setting. It was unreal!!!!! Only downside was there was not a gym and to get two miles in was tough since it meant running up a major hill but very doable. And the wifi would only hook on my husband's phone and not mine/nor our ipads. No biggie as really I should not be looking at work emails in this setting. Thanks for an amazing stay.
title: Beyond Beautiful

photos.caption: The salad prepared when we arrived.
View of our villa from afar.
Our private pool and lounge area.
View of the White Sands Beach we visited.
View from the main pool. Gorgeous view and were the only ones using it.

text: Very beautiful place and very wonderful hotel. The hotel has 3 villas and everything is perfect there! The hotel is situated on the sea shore in a wonderful lonely place with great views and nature with no tourist infrastructure around. Unfortunately, it was not possible to swim in a wonderful black sand beach, because of huge waves, but the hotel has a sweat water major swimming pool and each villa has its own salt water swimming pool, so we spend lots of time there. The waves were so huge that our villa was trembling at night! That was very impressive. But in spite of it the place is really ideal!
title: A wonderful place and wonderful hotel.

text:
I can't say enough positive things about this resort and we only stayed one night.  Staff and owners are great.  Food is top-notch. 

Value for your money in Bali is excellent but this hotel will cost you more: trust me, it's worth it and you're still paying less than you would elsewhere. Splurge.  

There are only 3 rooms at present so the hotel feels very cosy and quiet.  The rooms are wonderfully decorated and the grounds are outstanding.  

Getting here can be a challenge if your driver doesn't know the area so best have someone local take you.  

We spent our last night in Bali here and we can't wait to go back.
title: Heaven on Earth

text: This is the Bali indulgence holiday that people fantasise about but rarely find. We spent 6 nights at this idyllic, luxuriously boutique resort.  Perched on a volcanic rock cliff, all villas and the main pavilion overlook the Bali sea and 100s of colourful fishing boats as they return every morning.  We were in the Seaview villa with a large and private infinity pool, seperate day pavilion, and large main suite with bedroom, dressing room and a beautiful open garden bathroom.  The decor is modern, light coloured woods, leather furniture and very stylish, but all within a Balineses space.  The resort has a maximum capacity of 3 couples (3 villas) , and so the whole place feels like it just you.  Food is served in the elevated and breezy main pavilion with great views.  We went for the full board option as there are no other near eating options, and with food this good and all yours, ld you need other options. There is no set menu, rather each day you receive a surprise lunch and dinner that is Euopean influenced but cooked with the freshest  Balineses ingredients.  This produces a very interesting and delicious result.  A perfect place to just relax.  We stated each morning with a heart-pumping loop walk through the local village streets.  Then it was breakfast, private pool, relax, lunch, private ( or amazing resort pool - infinity 25 metres), relax, more pool, massage, dinner, private pool and sleep. It was very hard keeping up this pace for 7 days!  The only break in routine was a half day trip to Amed for very good beach snorkelling and a warung lunch.  This place is on par with some of the best boutique resorts we have stayed at in Bali, Thailand and vietnam.  We have been many times to Bali but this will be our first stop on our next trip.
title: Heavenly escape

text: If your looking for rest relaxation and to just do nothing and just be, then this is the place for you. Stunning views with scenery that is always changing. Gorgeous swimming pools that are private and a villa that will make you say wow. The food and the staff are nothing but exceptional. I will be going back again and if you choose to stay here you will not be disappointed. It is a long drive and there is no shopping but that is what it's all about just relaxing!
title: Absolutely beautiful

text: This place was great, and our hosts Nina and Andres were extremely hospitable. It is a short scooter ride from Candidasa and Amed so good diving is not far away and the scenery along the way is beautiful. The villas themselves are pristine, they have a great view and wonderful amenities such as an outdoor shower and large bath tub. Our villa also had its own infinity edge pool, however the shared pool was also wonderful with a great view. The black sand beach is nice for walks but not great for swimming as it has a very steep wash making for a hard break (once you are past this the swimming is good). The food is also great, I would recommend eating dinner and breakfast at the restaurant and catching lunch out. It is remote so if you are looking for night life, this is not really your place. If you want relaxation this is your place (the balinese massage is awesome). In all this is a very nice place.
title: Relaxed, beautiful, clean, and remote

text: We have been in many good resorts and Shunyata is really one of the best! Location, room, people and food are fantastic. The perfect place to relax! Just go there if you can! The food cooked is done with local ingredients and it is fantastic.. Mmmhh
title: Outstanding!

text:
This resort was one of the best places I've ever stayed. it by far exceeded all of my expectations. it was so quiet and beautiful. my villa was gorgeous; the outside bathroom (!!), the private infinity pool (!!)....it was amazing.

Also, the staff was hands-down amazing! I was the only guest this week and the staff could not have been friendlier! I came down with a cold for a couple of days and the staff did everything they could to make me feel at home. Additionally, they always offered up suggestions of places near-by to explore. 

For me, this trip was mostly about relaxing; i read a lot of books, got a sun tan, ate some of the best meals I've ever had and slept in. if that's good for you, then this is a no-brainer. the only thing I wish i did differently was not arrive at night. the roads are not well-maintained and the signage is a bit of a challenge. if arriving at night, definitely use the driver that maria and jurgen provide. it will make your arrival more pleasant.

i can't stop raving about my trip to bali + and i took a bagillion photos! i hope to go back one day!
title: i'm totally going back!

text:
The Shunyata Villas Bali stay was a real treat of relaxation and recovery in a luxurious setting.
The Villa was very well equipped, clean, spacious and with its own small infinity pool overlooking the splendid gardens and the ocean.
The wellness program: massages of all type, yoga classes, was all of best quality and the staff was really professional.
In-resort food: special menus and a la carte was healthy, sufficient and well served in the villa or the lovely restaurant.

Highly recommendable!!

text:
Upon departure, we found out that the shuttle transport to the nearest beach as well as the yoga lessons were charged to us - without us being informed about this in advance verbally (by the staff) or in writing (through the hotel's own brochures). 

While the costs for additional meals and the airport shuttle, for example, were transparently communicated to us in advance and only booked with our consent, the above-mentioned costs were not mentioned to us at any time. When checking out, we tried in vain to describe to the employee on site that these invoice items have come about without our knowledge and we feel cheated out of the money (1,660k IDR = 107€), he just said "sorry" several times and still held out the card reader to us. 

In the aftermath I wrote to the hotel 2x and asked for feedback, both times I received no answer. A more than disappointing end to our honeymoon!
title: ATTENTION:  HIGH HIDDEN COSTS!  NO FEEDBACK ON COMMUNICATION ATTEMPTS!

Despite 7 or 8 visits to the north and east of Bali, this was our first visit to Seraya. Five minutes drive out of the village down to the coast brings you to the cliff top sensation that is Shunyata. Villas in a whiter shade of pale keep watch over Lombok and Nusa Penida, whilst the resident goats and ducks monitor your progress up and down the superb 30+ metre infinity pool. 

The service from all the staff is first class and barely disturbs your train of thought, which in any case came off the normal rails hours ago, and now has you simply relecting on how good life can be.

 This level of experience does not come cheap, certainly in Bali terms, but if you see sense in investing in yourself  then Shunyata is a banker.
title: Time for reflection

text:
We had a truly wonderful stay at Shunyata for our honeymoon which was nothing short of perfect. 

We were welcomed on the first day by the wonderful staff and managerial team who brought us welcome drinks, a flower garland and walked us to our sea front villa in the comforting shade of traditional Balinese parasols. We then had a delicious meal before being lulled to sleep by the sound of the ocean waves breaking on the shore from the comfort of our four poster bed and air conditioned room, the unit of which didn't keep us up at all. 

Breakfast, lunch and dinner were all fabulous. The chef's eye for detail was clear from presentation to taste and texture. I'd definitely reccomend getting full board at Shunyata! 

The massage treatments were absolutely fantastic. We had two traditional Balinese massages and one hot stone massage. They released the tension in our bodies and brought us to a true state of calm and peace, I've never experienced something so tranquil. 

On the more active days, we went out to experience the "real" Bali. All arranged by Shunyata. On the first day we visited the magnificent temples in the mountains, steeped in history, as well as seeing some of Bali's beautiful natural waterfalls. 

The second day we had a cooking class with Kirtika. A luxury chef who invited us into his family run restaurant to learn traditional Balinese dishes. It blew our minds. We cooked alongside him for four hours before sitting to enjoy the fruits (and curries!) of our labour. We now have a notebook packed with recipes so we can take some of Bali home with us. 

Finally, the staff at Shunyata are so wonderful. You can tell they consider themselves a family. I fell ill one day and the manager Roland arranged for medicine, drinks and food to be sent over to our villa. All completely free of charge. Something he didn't have to do but was a testament to how committed he is to customer care as well as his character as a lovely person.  

Manuel was fantastic as a manager and yoga teacher. We had two brilliant sessions with him to improve our technique and learn more about the "Yin" style of yoga. He made sure to speak to us every evening and ensure that everything was ok. 

Riika was a wonderful and attentive individual. It was a pleasure to get to know her and we shared many lovely conversations. She even stayed after her shift to explain more about the Balinese culture and find out more about us. We feel truly honoured to know her story and that of Bali and it made our time here much more special. 

Shunyata is a tranquil oasis of calm, peace and luxury. The big things are done perfectly, but it's the quiet emphasis on "the little things" that propels Shunyata to being the best destination holiday my wife and I have ever been on. 

We will definitely be coming back. Thank you for providing us the most incredible experience. We can't think of a better way to begin our married life together.
title: A perfect way to start a marriage.

text:
Booked a 3D/2N stay at the Sky Villa (there are only 5 villas) for about US$ 250 a night inclusive breakfast,via Agoda.Lunch & Dinner was an additional IDR 500,000 and it's best to choose this option as the resort is pretty far away from any town/restaurants.

It took us about 2.5hrs to reach here from Kuta,where we stayed the night before.Traffic is pretty bad in Bali.

The resort is located in Seraya,on high land,overlooking the glorious sea.Although one can access the beach,there is no sand and swimming is not advisable due to the large waves.As there are only 5 villas here,things are pretty peaceful and quiet here.

Checkin was pretty informal and we were led to our villa (200sq.m) which had a private pool in the back and a large balcony overlooking the sea,in front.Villa was very clean and had all the amenities you would expect,but no TV.Very eco-friendly with minimal use of plastic bags.Wifi was decent.The bed was however,on the hard side.One had the option to either dine in the panorama restaurant or at the villa itself,and for breakfast,you could even have it in your private pool!! 

Service and food was great throughout.food was on the healthy side,no french fries or fried chicken here!

Drinks and wine prices were very reasonable too

If you are looking for a great place to get away from it all,this is it!!

text:
I never write Trip Advisor reviews. I'm always selfish enough to read through other people's reviews of places but have never written one of my own. I'm writing this one now because Shunyata deserves to get mentioned above and beyond any place that I've ever stayed before. This place is nothing short of spectacular. 

I must admit that I didn't know what to expect when we booked to spend the first 7 nights of our honeymoon in the Sea Villa (more on the choice of room later). The pictures all looked stunning but the location seemed fairly remote compared to some other big name locations on the island. A very quiet little town called Seraya on the far east coast of Bali. We took a chance and booked anyway as we were both intrigued. 

The drive is not ideal - 2 1/2 hours after a long haul flight was a bit of a killer. We arrived late in the evening and could just about make out the inky black sea in the distance and the incredible sound of the waves crashing into the volcanic rocky beach below. We went to bed, got up in the morning and our jaws dropped. The view beyond the (stunning) private infinity pool was uninterrupted blue sea. 

Shortly later our breakfast arrived, a procession of some of the girls in the hotel carrying  hot coffee, fresh fruit, pancakes, croissants and freshly squeezed juice. We got the breakfast every day and it was always of great quality. The luxury of being able to enjoy it in your private villa with a view like the one we had and the sounds of the waves was just a massive bonus. 

We'd then walk up into the village, greet all the fantastic and friendly locals (with all the kids who wanted to practice their English with you or just say hello). A steep hill to get up but worth it. It's location is either perfect for people who want to escape the rat race and the remoteness of it is part of the charm. Total relaxation is what the resort aims for and it nails it!

By the time we'd got back from our daily walk the villa would look pristine. The parasol would be up, the bed would be made and they had made up our sun loungers for the day as well with fresh towels. 

By that stage it was up to us. Lounge by the pool with a book in the sun, have a swim or pick up the phone to reception so we could organise a trip out to the beach, to a temple or get a massage, all of which the hotel would organise for you at a reasonable cost and with absolutely no fuss. 

We ate lunch and dinner during our time and were pleased to eat whatever options they had on each evening. Choice is limited but actually I thought this was a good thing as it got me eating and enjoying loads of options of food I might not have usually tried. My wife ate a lot of veggie meals too and we were both really thrilled to get served some fantastic three-course meals every evening. 

The main pool is beautiful but our private one was so good that we rarely got down for a swim. The villa was amazing - we stayed in the Sea Villa which (based on the pictures I've seen) had the best pool and the most space of all the villas. It was pure luxury with an outdoor shower and marble bathtub situated at the back and a big living space too. 

The main reason I wanted to write this review though was because of the staff. The girls in the restaurant, the managers at the front desk, all the cleaners etc. were just amazing. They're genuinely interested and invested in you as visitors to their corner of Bali. They want to help and advise you on where to go and what to see, and when you come back from visiting a local temple or having gone to the beach they want to know what you thought and how much you'd enjoyed it. 

If you want a lot of evening activity, local restaurants, bars, etc. don't come and then write a mixed review just because you didn't get any of that. Come to totally unwind, chill, enjoy the sights and sounds and spend a couple of days in paradise on earth. 

Loads of love guys! Liam and Emily.
title: Unbelievable.

text:
We spent 5 nights in the DELIGHT VILLA with beautiful views to the Indian Ocean and the most beautiful open bath I have ever seen.
We chose Shunyata Villas Bali as our honeymoon destination because we wanted to be away from mass tourism and take time for ourselves.

Our honeymoon package we booked included everything our heart desires. From super relaxing massages, candlelight dinners either in our villa or in the beautiful panorama restaurant, to the traditional blessing ceremony. :)

The complex is very well maintained and very tastefully furnished. A lot of attention to detail and very friendly staff. Eating was our highlight. Freshly selected ingredients very lovingly arranged and a great selection of dishes. There was always a choice of vegetarian/vegan dishes and a fish or meat option paired with a starter and dessert.

We felt very rested and are thankful that we could have this experience. We will definitely come back!
Thanks to the whole team.
title: DREAM Honeymoon <3

text: We loved the frangipani flower necklaces on arrival and were blown away by our villa with it's outdoor bathroom, zen garden, private pool and huge bedroom. Hubby was not impressed that there was no TV but the wifi was adequate enough to play movies on our laptop. The huge 32m main pool is breathtaking and excellent for early morning laps, although we loved swimming in our pool most of the time. There is a little beach but all black rocks and dangerous currents so you cannot swim in the sea here. There is also limited shops around and as the prices of the drinks, lunches and dinners were expensive and limited choices, we took a trip into the nearest town to stock up. We found the breakfast to be delicious but needs to be pre-ordered. We enjoyed the healthy bread and muesli, although we had to fight off the flies! We found a local restaurant just up the hill with delicious tuna dinners at a fraction of the price of the resort. Massages are excellent but expensive. As we stayed for 5 nights we were offered a free trip to White sand beach, which was well worth a visit. We hired a driver from the Warung up the road to go to Ahmed, an interesting clifftop trip to this beach where we snorkeled to the sunken ship - awesome! I recommend a visit if you really want to relax with very little other attractions within walking distance.
title: A piece of paradise for those looking for a complete relax

owner_response.text: Thank  you so much for your review. We are very happy that you liked our place so much. :-) We appreciate your valuable feedback. I am very sorry that you were not totally satisfied when it comes to the pricing. I can assure you that we do not charge extra on purpose because we are remote. You see, our place is fairly small, so we cook for 10 guests at most. We have high standards in terms of ingredient quality, we cook our individual menu´s 100% fresh each day (without any artificial flavours etc. and in organic quality as much as possible) and all is homemade (also bread, pasta, etc.). To keep this service for our guests on this level we have to ask for a specific price. You are right, the flies are really unpleasant attendants at breakfast during the rainy season. We are doing our best to keep them away with candles and incent sticks. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the trips! As mentioned previously, we are very thankful for your comment. This is very helpful, as it is important for us to improve the services for our guests constantly. We hope that you will keep your stay with us in good memory. All the very best & peace within, Shunyata Villas Bali
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This is a beautiful place, no question, and we had booked 3 nights in an Ocean View Villa, but we left after only 20 hours stay - this place is certainly an acquired taste, and unfortunately not ours.
The hotel itself if very nice, but it has been decorated more with consideration of looks, rather than function, and we spent the night in a beautifully decorated but uncomfortable bed with an aircon and a fridge fighting each other on who is louder - certainly for this quality hotel better quality appliances with less noise can be provided.
The villa we had did have a nice ocean view, but very restricted as it was boxed in, so I definitely recommend to choose another villa type.
The main pool is as spectacular as the pictures show, and almost worth the stay, but it was the only amazing part of our short stay.
Our main complaint is with the restaurant service - we knew the hotel was remote, but then you are really required to offer your guests an all day service of snacks and drinks, which was very much not the case.
There is a set menu for lunch and only served between 1 and 2 PM and dinner as well and only served 6.30 to 8 PM, and a very limited snack menu only from 1 to 4 PM.
As I did not like the dinner menu on the day we arrived, I had nothing to eat at all as it was after 4 PM, so I went to bed hungry.
All other hotels in Bali manage to keep a restaurant open all day, even with few rooms, so this is certainly not an expected standard.
For breakfast you have to order the day before, including the time you want to eat ..... and here you are only served one slice of bread per person (more is chargeable) and this is of their own baked bread .... a curry bread that was used also for my order of French toast - a really disgusting experience.
While the management was sitting having breakfast during our ordeal, they did not react at all to our complaints, but were busy on the mobile phones.
When we informed that we were leaving, we were treated professionally and the hotel paid for the dinner as well as the taxi to take us away.
title: Style over substance

owner_response.text:
Dear A-JJonassen,

thank you very much for your feedback, we appreciate that very much as we constantly are willing to improve the services for our guests.

I am really sorry that your stay with us here at Shunyata Villas Bali did not meet your expectations!

Honestly, I can not understand what exactly created this situation regarding the restaurant-service. It´s true, we have a set menu for 3-course lunch and 3-course dinner, but we always offer the guests to find an alternative in case they are not happy with our menu. Also the items from the snack card are available after 4pm if the guest asks for it. I apologize if something went wrong here with the communication.

Our kitchen creates a unique menu for lunch and dinner every day, with fresh/local ingredients (for the most part organic and without any artificial flavours) - that´s why we cannot have a huge variety of choices or a big standard menu. But we always do our best to prepare all dishes according to the preferences and specific requests of our guests.

We have more than 20 items on our breakfast list from which our guests can choose 6+ dishes (some are quite big like fruit platter, nasi/mie goreng, pancake, omelette, ...). That´s why we offer only one slice of our homemade bread (with a hint of cumin) if the guest is choosing bread from the list. But on request we always give another slice without additional charge.

We have a high quality standard regarding our room interior/furniture (especially for the bed but also for the A/C and other equipment) - you are actually the first guest in this villa mentioning any discomfort - I´m really sorry that you felt like that! I´m sure we could have been able to maximize the comfort (e.g. with additional bedsheeds) for you.

You described the villa as boxed with limited views - that´s also the first time we got that kind of feedback, usually the guests really love the villa you´ve booked. But of course, that´s a matter of personal preference ;-)


Unfortunately you´ve choosen to leave after the 1st night, so we did not get the chance to improve our service for you after your experience on your arrival day. But of course I absolutely respect your decision and I really hope that you had great holidays here in Bali!


All the very best to you,
Manuel
Management
Shunyata Villas Bali

text:
My wife and I found Shunyata Villas through a Google search and weren’t really sure what to expect. After spending a week in Seraya enjoying the food, the spectacular views, the massages, the villa, and the incredible staff, we would HIGHLY RECOMMEND anyone stay at Shunyata. The drive from Denpasar is long (between 2-3 hours), but the value that you get is one of the best you will find for a villa on the entire island. 

There are only a few villas to choose from, and we stayed in the SEA Villa. Everything is essentially outdoors except for the bedroom, which has a very comfortable bed and AC. We spent most of our time in the outdoor lounge area, the private pool, and the shared pool. The villa sits right on the ocean so you hear the loud waves crash along the shore throughout the day and night. Very cool! The staff and food at Shunyata are some of the best you will find on Bali. We saw the people more as friends than employees by the end of our trip. You can have meals in the main restaurant or have them brought to your villa. Both are great options depending on how you are feeling. We recommend doing the full board if you are just planning to stay around the villas - you really don’t want to miss out on the food. Some other recommendations for your stay are listed below. 

1. Cooking class with Kartika - This is as authentic a cooking class as you will find on Bali. Kartika owns a restaurant with his family, and he takes you to the market in the morning to buy the ingredients. Then, you make a bunch of courses with him and his family in original Balinese fashion. So incredibly delicious. The entire experience took about 6 hours. 
2. Balinese massages at Shunyata - These don’t need much explanation. You won’t be disappointed. 
3. Candlelight dinner - Ask management about this. It was one of the most special meals we had at Shunyata. 
4. Sorga Chocolate Factory - This is about 20 minutes from Shunyata. If you are a chocolate lover or want to learn how chocolate is made, this is a perfect experience for you. You can do a tour and tasting for a very small charge. The chocolate is fantastic and you can taste every flavor.
title: Dream Honeymoon, Anniversary or Celebration Location
